programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: San Francisco (20-6, 10-3) won four straight behind Malik Thomas, who leads the WCC in scoring with 19.2 ppg; Gonzaga (18-7, 9-3) is 10-1 at home, and won its last 30 meetings with the Dons dating back to 2013 after taking all three last season.

programme.title: 2025 4 Nations Face-Off
programme.desc: Teams of NHL players from Finland, Sweden, Canada and the United States are competing in the first best-on-best tournament since the 2016 World Cup of Hockey in Toronto; 4 Nations Face-Off games are played in accordance with NHL rules.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 14 Memphis (20-4, 10-1) won seven-straight games behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the AAC with 21.6 ppg; USF (12-12, 5-6) is 9-3 at home behind Jamille Reynolds, and beat the Tigers last season, 74-73, after losing the previous five meetings.

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Oklahoma finished in first place over LSU in second in their first meeting of the season at the Sprouts Farmer's Market Collegiate Quad on Jan. 11; the Sooners posted 197.950 points for the win behind an all-around title from Jordan Bowers.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: West Virginia (15-9, 6-7) dropped five of its last seven despite Javon Small, who is tied for first in the Big 12 with 18.5 ppg; Baylor (15-9, 7-6) is 11-1 at home, and won its last six meetings with the Mountaineers after a 94-81 win last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Louis (14-11, 7-5) is 3-8 away from home despite Gibson Jimerson, who is fifth in the Atlantic 10 in scoring with 17 ppg; Loyola (15-9, 6-5) is 12-1 at home, and won its last two meetings with the Billikens after losing the previous six.

programme.title: SC Featured
programme.desc: An in-depth examination of a particular athlete or issue that has captured the attention of sports fanatics across the nation; coverage includes exclusive interviews, exhaustive reporting and extensive expert analysis regarding the subject.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston breaks down fishing the thermocline, the transition layer between the warmer surface water and the colder deep water in lakes and oceans, discussing the challenges that come with fishing it and his tips for finding success.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Hand games have become a staple of young Black girls dating back generations, as the documentary traces the history of the games and the influence they have had on pop culture and the creative landscape, including music, dance and style.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes access follows Candace Parker through her 2022 WNBA season with the Chicago Sky as she pursues her third WNBA title, while also tracking her life back from her early days as an elite high school player at Naperville Central.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Washington State (16-10, 6-7) ended a five-game skid with an 87-86 win over Pepperdine; Saint Mary's (22-4, 12-1) is 13-1 at home, and beat the Cougars, 80-75, on Jan. 25 behind 25 points from Paulius Murauskas and 17 from Augustas Marciulionis.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at all things pertaining to college basketball, including previews of upcoming games, analysis of game-changing moments, discussions on breaking news, highlights of top players and more.

programme.title: UDA College Dance Championship: Pom
programme.desc: The top collegiate pom dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: With Michael Jordan's extraordinary fame came extraordinary scrutiny, and in 1993, it all felt like it came to a head with the Chicago Bulls' pursuit of a third straight title shadowed by question marks about Jordan's gambling.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title.

programme.title: UDA College Dance Championship: Jazz
programme.desc: The top collegiate jazz dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In the fall of 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls begin their quest to win a sixth NBA title in eight years, but "The Last Dance," as coach Phil Jackson called it, will be shadowed by tension with the club's front office.

programme.title: Women's Super League
programme.desc: Twelve fully professional teams compete in the highest league of women's soccer in England, and the top three teams qualify for the UEFA Women's Champions League.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan's fame peaked to unparalleled levels in the early 1990s in the wake of consecutive NBA titles and a starring role on the Olympic Dream Team, his image as "Air Jordan" made him a profoundly significant cultural figure.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan is left to begin the 1997-98 season without his injured sidekick Scottie Pippen, whose contract dispute with the Bulls' front office reaches a fever pitch as the team gets off to one of the worst starts of its championship runs.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1992, Deion Sanders, who was a two-way player with the Atlanta Falcons and an outfielder for the Atlanta Braves, attempts to play two National League playoff games and an NFL regular season game in a span of 24 hours in two different cities.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Two 60-lap races determine the final 38 positions on the starting grid for the Daytona 500; Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell won the two races last year, and a Duel winner has won the "The Great American Race" on nine separate occasions.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in second event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Brendan Steele won the individual crown with a one-shot victory over Louis Oosthuizen, while Ripper GC beat Stinger GC in a playoff for the team crown in last year's edition.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series Qualifying
programme.desc: NASCAR Truck Series drivers qualify for the Fresh From Florida 250, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position; Ty Majeski averaged 178.767 mph en route to winning the pole last year but would finish the race in 15th place.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Practice
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency for the Daytona 500; crews work to set up the car.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.desc: The National Football League presents a closer, documentary-style look at the teams and towns featured prominently each Sunday in the league, as well as a look at the most enigmatic personalities of the league and the impressive plays of the weekend.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.desc: Two 60-lap races determine the final 38 positions on the starting grid for the Daytona 500; Tyler Reddick and Christopher Bell won the two races last year, and a Duel winner has won the "The Great American Race" on nine separate occasions.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: The ARCA Menards Series heads to the Ride the 'Dente 200 at Daytona International Speedway for the opening race of the season in Daytona Beach, Florida; Gus Dean claimed the race win at Daytona in the season opener from the 2024 season.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Two-time Daytona 500 winner Bobby Allison picked up his fifth win at the 2.5-mile oval in the Firecracker 400 the previous year, as Bobby and his son, Davey, would make history in the 30th running of the prestigious NASCAR race.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Cavalry FC overcame a one-goal deficit in the second half to secure a 2-1 triumph over Pumas UNAM in the first leg matchup on Feb. 6, as Charlie Trafford scored the equalizer, while Tobias Warschewski scored the match-winner in the 80th minute.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: United States's last action was a 3-2 loss to Germany in the World Cup round of 16 on Nov. 21, 2023, where Taha Habroune and David Vazquez had their goals; Saint Kitts and Nevis lost to the Dominican Republic, 5-1, in 2022 Championship qualification.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: Over 300 dogs compete in two qualifying rounds consisting of a Standard Agility and a Jumper with Weaves course, with the 10 dogs with the highest combined scores from each of the five height classes advancing; Nimble, a mixed-breed dog, won in 2024.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Forge FC is 0-0-5 all-time in the competition; Monterrey won the inaugural encounter against the Hammers with a 2-0 triumph in the first leg matchup on Feb. 5, as Nelson Deossa and Jordi Cortizo each found the back of the net in the second half.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Hilal claimed a 3-0 victory over Al-Riyadh in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 14, led by a goal and assist from Salem Al-Dawsari; Aleksandar Mitrović found the third goal of the match after an own-goal from Yoann Barbet.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.desc: UCLA (18-7, 9-5) had its seven-game win streak snapped by Illinois, 83-76; Indiana (15-10, 6-8) ended its five-game skid with a 71-67 upset of No. 11 Michigan State, and is 11-3 at home behind Oumar Ballo, who leads the team with 13.7 ppg.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Indy claimed a 3-1 victory over Orlando in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 11, behind 25 kills, 18 digs and 2 blocks from Leketor Member-Meneh; Brittany Abercrombie posted 17 kills and 9 digs for the Valkyries in the defeat.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The Dominican Republic is coming off of claiming a 1-0 victory over Aruba on Feb. 10 through a winning goal by Ismahel Saidani Sanchez in the 21st minute; Panama beat Grenada with an 8-0 scoreline, led by a hat-trick from Mikel Prado.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Wests Tigers has finished last in the ladder in each of the three previous seasons; Canterbury-Bankstown has won three of the past four encounters, including a 22-14 triumph on May 4, as the Bulldogs held the Tigers scoreless in the second half.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Gold Coast (0-0-0) has won the past three meetings with the Broncos, including a 46-18 victory last season in Round 22, as Jojo Fifita scored three tries and Keano Kini notched two tries; Brisbane (0-0-0) finished 12th in the final ladder in 2024.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Bermuda is coming off of claiming a 3-1 victory over Anguilla on Feb. 9, led by a pair of goals from Kennahz Fray and 2 assists by Noah Outerbridge; Canada also comes off a win over Anguilla, on Feb. 11, 8-0, behind an Aidan Evans brace.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Barbados is coming off of a 1-0 victory over Dominica on Feb. 11 through an own-goal from Kimani Rodney in the 83rd minute of play; Belize suffered a 3-0 defeat to Mexico where they conceded a penalty in the 38th minute and two goals after halftime.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Saint Vincent is coming off of suffering a 5-0 defeat to Haiti on Feb. 11, where they conceded three goals in the first half, including a Nikolai Pierre brace; Antigua lost to Guatemala, 2-0, with their lone goal of the defeat scored by Sakidi Meade.
